condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Covid-19 Preparedness & Response in Schools

description.narrative: UNICEF built humanitarian preparedness and response capacity of the PNG WASH cluster through training of 16 cluster partner representatives and procuring WASH in emergency coordination handbook and WASH resilience guidelines for the cluster members. UNICEF contributed to strengthen rapid assessment tools and assessed WASH needs of the refugee influx from West Papua and sourced WASH supplies to meet the needs of the population in camps. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/01/2020

title.narrative: Status of a national assessment of WASH and IPC in health care facilities (e.g. WASH-FIT) in the reporting year with UNICEF support (none, planned, ongoing, completed) [COVID]
Number of health centres (clinics, hospitals, etc.) equipped with WASH facilities in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support [COVID]
Number of people who have access to safe drinking water of agreed standards
Number of people reached with life-saving hygience messages
Number of targeted population provided with hygiene kits or key hygiene items in the reporting year [COVID]
Existence of functioning cluster coordination mechanism for water, sanitation and hygiene in humanitarian situations
Number of people who have access to functional latrines of agreed standards
Number of girls and boys in learning centers and child friendly spaces with access to WaSH services
Availability of a costed plan in place to promote hygiene and handwashing in response to COVID-19 [COVID]
People in humanitarian situations who access safe drinking water as per agreed sector/cluster coordination standards and norms
